DOC.brief_summary: To determine whether specialized enteral nutrition support improve oxygenation status critically ill patient acute lung injury ( ALI ) acute respiratory distress syndrome ( ARDS ) compare standard enteral nutritional formula .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Enteral Nutrition Support Critically Ill Patients
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male nonpregnant female . 2 . ALI ARDS 3 . PaO2/FiO2 > 100 ≤ 300 torr . 4 . Evidence bilateral pulmonary infiltrates/opacity chest radiograph . 5 . Enteral access 6 . Systemic inflammatory response syndrome ( SIRS ) two follow must present : 1 . Body temperature le 36°C great 38°C 2 . Heart rate > 90 beat per minute 3 . Tachypnea > 20 breath per minute ; arterial partial pressure carbon dioxide < 4.3 kPa ( 32 mmHg ) 4 . White blood cell count < 4000 cells/mm³ > 12,000 cells/mm³ ; presence > 10 % immature neutrophil . 1 . Dialysis renal failure 2 . Unable initiate Enteral feeding within 48 hour since inclusion criterion meet . 3 . Anticipated life expectancy le 24 hour . 4 . Patient severe chronic liver disease 5 . Neuromuscular disease impairs ability ventilate without assistance 6 . Head trauma and/or drown Glasgow coma score 5 7 . Receiving intravenous lipid emulsion parenteral nutrition within 12 hour baseline . 8 . Receiving propofol 9 . Airway reconstructive surgery . 10 . Malignancy irreversible disease 6month mortality great 50 % . 11 . Burns great 25 % total body surface area . 12 . Unwillingness inability utilize ARDS network ventilation protocol . 13 . HIV positive . 14 . Chronic mechanical ventilation . 15 . Severe , acute pancreatitis . 16 . Refractory shock 17 . Congestive heart failure pulmonary edema primary cause hypoxemia . 18 . Acute myocardial infarction cardiac surgery within 7 day . 19 . Solid organ transplant . 20 . INR > 5.0 platelet count < 30,000/mm3 history bleed disorder . 21 . Intracranial hemorrhage within past 30 day .
